text: Martin resident Dr. Gene Little has been awarded the prestigious Building Excellence Schools Fellowship.

text: The former principal of Carr Elementary in Fulton and UT Martin alumna is the sole recipient from Tennessee.

text: This highly competitive fellowship is awarded to only 8 to 10 outstanding educational leaders nationwide each year.

text: Throughout the fellowship year, Dr. Little will engage in comprehensive training and development.

text: This includes eight weeks of residences in the nation's highest performing schools.

text: In addition to working at Carr Elementary, she'd spent 11 years teaching high school English in O'Brien County and three years in leadership roles, including working in the Jackson-Madison County school system and with the Department of Education.
